page.title: 03CHEESE FACTORY NEWTON ST.C.
page.content: {THE BUTTER.} We saw the cream being heated and turned into butter. It is drained, cut inpieces and shaped. Lastly the man squeezes off a handful, weighs it in 250g pieces and wraps each portion.{This is all done by {hand. QUICKE'S MATURE CHEDDAR CHEESE. Firstly the curds and whey{are stirred {in large vats by huge machine whisks. The mixture is heated to a high temperature to kill off germs. Then the{whey is drained for pig food}and the curd cheese is placed in moulds. {Fine cloth is wrapped round each to {make the rind.}It must not be punctured otherwise the cheese goes mouldy.The cheeses,{worth Â£60 each, {are stored in racks, turned daily and {kept for 9 months.}Most of the cheese is sold to Marks and Spencer, the rest to small shops.
